summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and federal prosecutors (USANYS) from 2019 to 2021. It primarily concerns scheduling meetings and interviews for Nascimento's client, who is cooperating with the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss proffer meetings, travel logistics, and the client's cooperative status.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a client who is cooperating with the federal investigation into Epstein/Maxwell. He communicates with prosecutors to schedule meetings, proffers, and interviews for his client.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of her arrest in July 2020. Nascimento references her arrest when checking in with prosecutors about his client's status.

persons.name: Alan Rosen
persons.context: Identified as Nascimento's former law partner who passed away in 2018. His former partner (a female agent) was served with a grand jury subpoena related to the Epstein case.

connections.description: Nascimento is not directly representing Maxwell, but his client is involved in the same investigation that led to Maxwell's arrest. He references her arrest when communicating with prosecutors.
Nascimento describes Alan Rosen as his former law partner. After Rosen's death, Nascimento was contacted by Rosen's former partner regarding a grand jury subpoena in the Epstein case.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Arrest
events.description: Nascimento references seeing reports of Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest and checks in with prosecutors regarding his client's status.

events.title: Prosecutor Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: Nascimento and his client met with federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach, Florida, as part of the investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting at Hilton West Palm Beach
events.description: A meeting was scheduled between Nascimento, his client, and prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach on Okeechobee Blvd.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Interview
events.description: A videoconference interview (via WebEx) was scheduled for Nascimento's client with prosecutors.

events.title: Proposed Proffer Meeting
events.description: Prosecutors proposed holding a proffer meeting with Nascimento's client on this date, which Nascimento sought to reschedule to the afternoon.

locations: 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue, Miami, FL 33129 (Lawyer's Plaza, office of Ross Amsel Raben Nascimento, PLLC)
Hilton in West Palm Beach, 600 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach, FL
keyFacts: Attorney Joseph Nascimento represented a client who was actively cooperating with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The correspondence reveals a series of in-person proffer meetings and interviews scheduled in Florida (West Palm Beach) between 2019 and 2021.
Prosecutors repeatedly affirmed the client's cooperative status and that nothing in their investigation had changed their view of the client negatively.
Nascimento referenced the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in July 2020 as a point for checking in on his client's status with prosecutors.
The emails show coordination around a grand jury subpoena served on the former partner of Nascimento's deceased law partner, Alan Rosen, linking another individual to the investigation.
